00020 
00021 // We use vil_image_resources since they are not in memory, and we might
00022 // have a very large collection of images.
00023 #include <vil/vil_image_resource.h>

00042 
00043 // The default driver for the bundler routines. Uses the functions packaged
00044 // in routines to calculate the pose of each of the cameras and a set
00045 // of 3D points from the images included in imageset. These values
00046 // are placed in cameras and points, respectively. Also includes a matrix
00047 // which holds which points are available from which cameras.
00048 // The focal_length should hold information extracted from the EXIF tags for
00049 // each image. It either holds the focal length in pixels, or
00050 // BUNDLER_NO_FOCAL_LEN for images that either don't have an exif tag
00051 // or whose exif tag is missing the focal length.
00052 bool bundler_driver(
00053     const bundler_routines &routines,
00054     const vcl_vector<vil_image_resource_sptr> &imageset,
00055     const vcl_vector<double> &exif_tags,
00056 
00057     vcl_vector<vpgl_perspective_camera<double> > &cameras,
00058     vcl_vector<vgl_point_3d<double> > &points,
00059     vnl_sparse_matrix<bool> &visibility_graph);
00060 
00061 
00062 // Creates a file according to the PLY specifications, containing
00063 // the point data held in points.
00064 bool bundler_write_ply_file(
00065     const char *filename,
00066     const vcl_vector<vgl_point_3d<double> > &points);
00067     
00068 bool bundler_write_bundle_file(
00069     const char* filename,
00070     const vcl_vector<vpgl_perspective_camera<double> > &cameras,
00071     const vcl_vector<vgl_point_3d<double> > &points);
00072 
00073 // A collection of routines that provide the feature phase of
00074 // the bundler pipeline. There are three constructors, one for the default,
00075 // which will use the routines for the standard feature matching as well as
00076 // default settings, another which allows the user to specify thresholds,
00077 // and the last which takes in pointers to the stages used. If the default
00078 // stages are used (the first or second constructor), the stages are freed
00079 // in the destructor, otherwise, the stages are left well enough alone.
00080 class bundler_tracks
00081 {
00082     private:
00083         bool manage_pointers;
00084 
00085     public:
00086         bundler_tracks_detect *detect_features;
00087         bundler_tracks_propose_matches *propose_matches;
00088         bundler_tracks_match *match;
00089         bundler_tracks_refine *refine;
00090         bundler_tracks_chain_matches *chain_matches;
00091 
00092         // A constructor that uses the default pipeline stages as well
00093         // as default settings for each stage.
00094         bundler_tracks();
00095 
00096         // A constructor that uses the default pipeline stages, but
00097         // allows the user to override the settings for each stage.
00098         // The settings include thresholds, number of iterations, and
00099         // similar details.
00100         bundler_tracks(bundler_settings_tracks s);
00101 
00102         // Constructor that allows an override of each of the stages
00103         // of the feature pipeline. These pointers are managed
00104         // externally! As in, if you allocate them, you must
00105         // deallocate them.
00106         bundler_tracks(
00107             bundler_tracks_detect *d,
00108             bundler_tracks_propose_matches *ml,
00109             bundler_tracks_match *ma,
00110             bundler_tracks_refine *re,
00111             bundler_tracks_chain_matches *cm):
00112 
00113             manage_pointers(false),
00114             detect_features(d), propose_matches(ml),
00115             match(ma), refine(re), chain_matches(cm) { }
00116 
00117         // The destructor that frees the allocations made in the
00118         // constructor, if there are any.
00119         ~bundler_tracks() {
00120             if (manage_pointers) {
00121                 delete detect_features;
00122                 delete propose_matches;
00123                 delete match;
00124                 delete refine;
00125                 delete chain_matches;
00126             }
00127         }
00128 
00129         // A convienence method that runs the entire feature matching
00130         // pipeline. Alternatively, you can directly call functors
00131         // yourself.
00132         virtual void run_feature_stage(
00133             const vcl_vector<vil_image_resource_sptr> &imageset,
00134             const vcl_vector<double> &focal_lengths,
00135 
00136             bundler_inters_reconstruction &empty_recon) const;
00137 };
00138 
00139 
00140 // A collections of routines that provides the structure from motion (sfm)
00141 // phase of the bundler pipeline. The constructors are similar to the above.
00142 class bundler_sfm
00143 {
00144     private:
00145         bool manage_pointers;
00146 
00147     public:
00148         bundler_sfm_create_initial_recon *create_initial_recon;
00149 
00150         bundler_sfm_select_next_images *select_next_images;
00151 
00152         bundler_sfm_add_next_images *add_next_images;
00153 
00154         bundler_sfm_add_new_points *add_new_points;
00155 
00156         bundler_sfm_bundle_adjust *bundle_adjust;
00157 
00158         // A constructor that uses the default pipeline stages as well as
00159         // default settings for each stage
00160         bundler_sfm();
00161 
00162         // A constructor that uses the default pipeline stages, but
00163         // allows the user to override the settings for each stage.
00164         // The settings include thresholds, number of iterations, and
00165         // similar details.
00166         bundler_sfm(bundler_settings_sfm s);
00167 
00168         // Constructor that allows an override of each of the stages
00169         // of the sfm pipeline. These pointers are managed
00170         // externally! As in, if you allocate them, you must
00171         // deallocate them.
00172         bundler_sfm(
00173             bundler_sfm_create_initial_recon *cir,
00174             bundler_sfm_select_next_images *sni,
00175             bundler_sfm_add_next_images *ani,
00176             bundler_sfm_add_new_points *anp,
00177             bundler_sfm_bundle_adjust *ba) :
00178                 create_initial_recon(cir), select_next_images(sni),
00179                 add_next_images(ani), add_new_points(anp),
00180                 bundle_adjust(ba) {}
00181 
00182         // The destructor that frees the allocations made in the
00183         // constructor, if there are any.
00184         ~bundler_sfm() {
00185             if (manage_pointers) {
00186                 delete create_initial_recon;
00187                 delete select_next_images;
00188                 delete add_next_images;
00189                 delete add_new_points;
00190                 delete bundle_adjust;
00191             }
00192         }
00193 
00194         // A convenience method that runs the entire sfm matching
00195         // pipeline. Alternatively, you can directly call functors
00196         // yourself.
00197         virtual bool run_sfm_stage(
00198             bundler_inters_reconstruction &empty_recon,
00199 
00200             vcl_vector<vpgl_perspective_camera<double> > &cameras,
00201             vcl_vector<vgl_point_3d<double> > &points,
00202             vnl_sparse_matrix<bool> visibility_graph) const;
00203 };
00204 
00205 
00206 // A wrapper struct for the functions bundler_driver will use.
00207 struct bundler_routines
00208 {
00209     bundler_tracks features_phase;
00210     bundler_sfm sfm_phase;
00211 
00212     // Uses default everything, stages and settings
00213     bundler_routines() {}
00214 
00215     // Uses the default stages, but allows the user to specify settings
00216     // for the thresholds.
00217     bundler_routines(bundler_settings s):
00218         features_phase(s.feature_settings),
00219         sfm_phase(s.sfm_settings) {}
00220 
00221     // Allows the user to specify a set of feature and sfm routines
00222     // to use.
00223     bundler_routines(bundler_tracks f, bundler_sfm s) {
00224         features_phase = f;
00225         sfm_phase = s;
00226     }
00227 };

00230 #endif // BUNDLER_H
